isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES FOR.. - ...LOW POWER

step2.para: Determine how power or performance is checked.
Compare to identical units in same type operation. (Refer to "PERFORMANCE DATA GUIDELINES").

step1.para: Determine the cause of the problem:

step2.para: Check fuel type and grade. Refer to appropriate "OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE" manual.
Inspect shutoff cable or electric shutoff for proper adjustment.

Inspect the throttle cable for full travel from low idle stop to high idle stop under all conditions of operation. Make certain the operation of the vehicle is not changing these adjustments. Verify high idle.
Inspect throttle cable over-travel at wide open throttle with engine running. Refer to Section 5 for procedure.

note.para: Throttle cable over-travel is the adjustment made on the throttle cable which compensates for wear that occurs in the throttle linkage and for chassis movement. If throttle cable over-travel is not maintained, full throttle and consequently, maximum performance will not be available.

item.para: Change filter if pressure is low
Check for fuel inlet restriction if new fuel filter did not correct the low transfer pump pressure.
If fuel inlet is not being restricted and fuel pressure is still low replace fuel return valve or transfer pump.
Service air cleaner element(s) as necessary

step2.para: Check injection pump timing and correct with injection pump on engine.
Intake manifold pressure loss or aneroid diaphragm leakage.

item.para: Pressurize intake system and inspect for leaks at all (boost pressure) connections. Air leakage may occur at line connectors or on the boost line to the aneroid. During engine operation leaks at the connectors can cause manifold pressure to be reduced at the aneroid which allows the injection pump to operate in "cut back" or reduced power level.

Test aneroid diaphragm by applying (20 psi max.) air pressure, using the D-200 Pressure Test Kit, for 30 seconds. If leakage occurs, replace diaphragm. Low power and low manifold pressure will result if diaphragm leaks because injection pump will stay in "cut back" position.
